b: focused on her childhood and early life

question: What was Octavia Butler’s first novel?

question: What does the framing paragraph at the beginning of “Childfinder“ say the telepaths could have done?
c: drawn attention from other telepathic civilizations

question: Why does the protagonist of 'Childfinder' move to a new house?
a: She detected a powerful telepath in the area.
b: She is trying to avoid the organization.
c: She is on the run from the government.
d: Someone in the area has been contacting her telepathically.

question: What does the protagonist of “Childfinder” do with her powers before moving into a new house?
b: kill off all the pests inside
c: kill the organization spy that was planted there
d: get a lower rent from the landlord

question: What has Valerie been using her telepathy for before meeting “Childfinder’s” protagonist?
How old is the “Childfinder” protagonist's neighbor?
What does the protagonist of “Childfinder” notice about Valerie when she shows up in the morning?
d: she looks just like her mother

question: Valerie tells the protagonist of “Childfinder” that the book was damaged
a: when she was attacked on the way over
b: when she tripped and dropped it
c: because her mom tried to grab it away from her
d: when her brother played with it
e: because she threw it at her best friend

question: Why does “Childfinder’s” protagonist act upset with Valerie?
a: to throw Valerie off guard so she can read her mind
b: she wants to see how Valerie will react
c: she is genuinely mad about the book’s damage
d: she thinks Valerie will be suspicious if she doesn’t
e: she needs to put on a show to distract the other telepaths

question: What historical figure is the book Valerie delivered about?
What does “Childfinder’s” protagonist do to Valerie during their conversation about the book?
a: cleans her clothes and washes her hair
d: unlocks the full potential of her psionic ability
e: put her in the book’s setting

question: Who does Valerie call a “long-haired motherfucker”?
b: one of the characters in the book

question: In “Childfinder,” what does Valerie ask Barbara about the characters in the book she read?
b: why they were so afraid to go free
c: if the same thing could happen to her
e: whether any of them were still alive

question: What does Eve do to Valerie that Barbara does not like?
a: puts a hand on her shoulder
b: speaks to her like a child

question: What does Eve accuse Barbara of doing?
c: betraying them to the normal humans

question: In “Childfinder”, the members of the organization think that they are
a: destined by a prophecy to rule all other humans
b: hated and feared by normal humans
c: too complex for a normal human to understand
d: the secret masters of the world

question: What did Barbara do to the two white children she had discovered were pre-childfinders?
What does Eve use her telepathy to try and do to Barbara in “Childfinder”?
a: show her how much better the world would be if she joined
c: shut off her telepathic powers permanently
d: lie and hide her true intentions
e: force her to accept the organization’s 'invitation'

question: Whom did Eve bring on her visit to Barbara in “Childfinder”?
a: the rest of the organization’s leadership
c: the first child Barbara ever found for them
d: a hostage taken from Barbara’s group
e: her own group of telepathic children

question: When one of the men screamed and fell in “Childfinder”, Barbara realized
a: she had been rescued by one of her own telepaths
b: they had to finish quickly or else they would be discovered
c: there was a third faction of telepaths present
d: she had been unconsciously using her own telepathy to attack
e: they were being fired at from the rooftops

question: What compliment from a visiting student gave Jordan a swell head in “Childfinder”?
a: he should apply to join their university
b: he looked like he was from an African tribe
c: he looked well dressed and respectable
d: he was the strongest telepath they’d ever seen
e: he would be a very wealthy man one day

question: What does Barbara do to her children after they try to save her in “Childfinder”?
b: promise to return the favor one day
e: give them all the knowledge she has about the organization

question: In “Childfinder”, what does Barbara tell her telepaths to do before she gives herself over to the organization?
b: use their powers to avenge her
d: remember how much love she has for them
e: tell the world the truth about telepaths

question: What does Jessie Mae fear will happen to Barbara “Childfinder”?
a: she is going to rejoin the organization
b: she will let the organization kill her
c: the organization will read her mind
d: she will give their locations away
e: she will never see them again

question: What does Barbara do to herself before the organization can read her mind?
a: hides a secret weapon in her own thoughts
d: makes herself forget how to find pre-telepaths
e: removes all of her telepathic powers

question: The narration at the end of “Childfinder” mentions that legends claim the telepaths
a: formed a society with true equality
c: were wiped out by a mysterious explosion

question: What does the framing device at the end of “Childfinder” confidently state about the downfall of the psionic civilization?
a: They never achieved their full potential.
b: They were wiped out by a more powerful race of telepaths.
c: They were wiped out by external forces.
d: They are still hiding among us today.
e: They were wiped out by internal conflict.
